Selecting a Freight Forwarder

May 13, 2013
When shipping a product overseas as part of a commercial transaction, the exporter must be aware of packing, labeling, documentation, and insurance requirements. An international freight forwarder is an agent for the exporter and can move cargo from “dock-to-door,” providing several significant services. In this webinar you will learn how to select a forwarder; how a freight forwarder can help minimize shipping costs; documents that forwarders can process and submit on your behalf; and how forwarders coordinate with their counterparts in other countries to clear customs and get your goods to the customer. Download the full video (130 Mb)
